title: Raise error when version given to `single_version_override` is different from main module

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

body:
### Description of the feature request:


This request seeks to avoid a scenario where an "upgrade" has been performed but hasn't taken affect due to a `single_version_override`.

For example;
```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_jvm_external", version = "6.7")
single_version_override(
    module_name = "rules_jvm_external",
    version = "5.3",
)
```

It would be nice if as a safety net such contradictions were reported by Bazel via an error. Similar to when a resolved module version doesn't match what the main module has requested due to another module requesting a newer version.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

_No response_

### What underlying problem are you trying to solve with this feature?


This is an obvious mistake once spotted, but easily missed if (for example);
- 2 PRs are merging concurrently. 1 adding the override, the other upgrading the overridden dependency.
- PR rebased on changes that add an override and the semantic conflict is missed (very easy if rebasing to merge post-review)
- The `single_version_override` isn't close to the `bazel_dep`.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Linux, macOS

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 7.6.1
